description: From Middle English abundantly, abundauntli, habundantly, habundauntliche, equivalent to abundant +â€Ž -ly.

adverbs.description: abundantly (comparative more abundantly, superlative most abundantly)

entries.meaning: In an abundant manner; in a sufficient degree; in large measure. [First attested around 1350 to 1470.]

examples: The explosion, in other words, was unexpected, powerful, and politically diffuse; it vented sharp African frustrations with the colonial situation, but had no readily visible leadership or political goals; it made abundantly obvious the need to speed the pace of self-government
